p: The contact and fumigant activities of thymol were stronger than that of non-phenolic aromatic ( p-cymene) and non-aromatic hydrocarbon (γ-terpinene). It was suggested that thymol potentiates GABA (γ-aminobutyric acid) receptors [ 45], and blockage of the GABA-gated chloride channel reduces neuronal inhibition which leads to hyper-excitation of the central nervous system, convulsions, and eventual death [ 46].
